    Projects

    Research Projects

    Explore our ongoing and completed research projects spanning various areas of artificial intelligence, with particular focus on medical imaging, computer vision, and smart systems.

    Ongoing Projects

    SMART-HOTEL 360

    AI-powered solutions for the hospitality industry

    Duration: 2025-2027
    Funding: Ministry of Regional Development and EU Funds (IP.1.1.03.0160)

    OPTIDERM

    Optical Diagnostics of Dermal Infections

    Duration: 2023-2027
    Funding: Croatian Science Foundation (IP-2022-10-2433) & Slovenian Research Agency (N3-0348)

    Project Website

    Multimodal Foundation Model for Medical Radiology

    Development of cutting-edge multimodal foundation models for medical radiology

    Duration: 2024-ongoing
    Funding: University of Rijeka (uniri-iskusni-tehnic-23-12 2947)

    Recent Projects

    RadiologyNET

    Machine Learning for Knowledge Transfer in Medical Radiology

    Duration: 2021-2024
    Funding: Croatian Science Foundation (IP-2020-02-3770)

    Project Website

    TSAAI

    Transversal Skills in Applied Artificial Intelligence

    Duration: 2022-2025
    Funding: Erasmus+ 2021-1-ES01-KA220-HED-000030125

    Project Website

    Summer School on Image Processing (SSIP 2021)

    International summer school in image processing and computer vision

    Year: 2021

    Website

    Adria Smart Room

    Intelligent room systems with AI-powered features for hospitality

    Duration: 2020-2023
    Funding: HAMAG-BICRO (KK.01.2.1.02.0303)

    Project Website

    Completed Projects

    Development of Machine Learning Techniques for Medical Images (2019-2023)

    University of Rijeka grant (uniri-tehnic-18-15) focused on illness and injury detection in medical images.
    Project Details

    Computer-Aided Digital Analysis and Classification of Signals (2019-2023)

    University of Rijeka grant (uniri-tehnic-18-17)

    Hyperspectral Image Analysis Using Machine Learning (2020-2022)

    Bilateral project with the Medical Physics Group at the Faculty of Mathematics and Physics, Ljubljana, Slovenia

    Thorax Motion Supervision in Radiotherapy (2018-2019)

    Bilateral project using machine learning techniques in cooperation with Ljubljana, Slovenia

    International Collaborations

    We actively collaborate with:

    • Faculty of Mathematics and Physics, Ljubljana, Slovenia - Medical Physics Group
    • Various European institutions through Erasmus+ programs
    • Industry partners in hospitality and healthcare sectors

    Open Source Contributions

    We believe in open science and regularly release code and datasets:

    • kneeMRI Dataset: Medical imaging dataset for knee MRI analysis

    More datasets and code available on our GitHub
